summary: i would just like to say that gendrya is canon and that’s all
question: i would just like to say that gendrya is canon and that’s all
answer:
Of course it is! As we all know, Arya rode to Storm’s End after King’s Landing and confessed her love to Gendry but confided in him her insecurities about her inability to be the “proper lady” he deserves. Gendry convinced her that he doesn’t want a “proper lady,” and that he wasn’t asking her to give up her independence and agency to marry him–he was asking her to let him love her for who she is, to rule as his equal and be the good leader she’s always known in her heart she could be. They got married in a secret ceremony with only Davos as witness. Arya had to go back to Winterfell to help her family free Jon while Gendry stayed in SE to get acquainted with his lordship duties. While apart, they corresponded daily via raven and Arya admitted to Gendry that her restlessness and night terrors were getting worse to the point where she could barely function, so together, they decided that she should leave Westeros for a while so she could heal properly from her trauma without the added stress of leadership responsibilities. The council meeting happened and they went public with their marriage (the claw marks on Gendry’s doublet were not subtle), they enjoyed a second honeymoon by banging all over SE while her ship was being built, then she set sail while Gendry stayed behind to rule over the Stormlands during the transition into King Bran’s rule. Arya sailed for a year, discovered that West of Westeros is actually just East of Essos (they all had a good laugh about that), then she came back to SE tanned and ready to help Gendry lead their people (and learn how to use a fork). Arya and Gendry became the most beloved lord and lady in the history of the Stormlands, they had multiple children due to all the rabbit sex (their firstborn being a daughter who inherited SE because Arya put an end to male-only primogeniture), and they lived happily ever after.

What part of this is making people doubt gendrya is canon? Oh, you mean the part where d&d were too lazy and/or cowardly to include any of this in the finale? Well, what can you do. Their ineptitude doesn’t change that fact that, yes, gendrya is indeed canon.

blog.name: katlyn1948
blog.title: A Place To Vent

title: Only Human: Part 2
body:
So I know that I said I would post yesterday, but I forgot, I am sorry! But do not fear, part 2 is here! I may actually make this a 5 parter…anyway, here you go! 

Arya had been quick with her goodbyes. She didn’t want to delay her travels any longer and she feared that, if given the time, she would remain in Westeros. As she was beginning to dock her ship, her brother had made a rather impromptu appearance. She was surprised by his visit on the ship dock, but took it with pleasure.

“Can’t say enough goodbye?” She asked as she approached his chair.

“There were things that I could not say whilst in the council room, surrounded by prying ears.” He told her, simply.

Arya pursed her lips together and studied her brother’s face. Since their reunion, he had remained stoic and unreadable, but after the War for the Dawn she began to see remnants of her old brother coming to the surface. It was easier for her to see where his mind would wonder off too, or even the slight grin that he would produce every now and then reminded her that Bran was still in there, somewhere.

“Please, leave us, Lord Tyrion.” Bran had said to the imp. He gave a swift nod and moved to stand just beyond the dock.

Arya crouched down so she was level with her brother. She wanted to be able to look him in the eye when they spoke; to be on his level.

“What is it, Bran? I am already late leaving, I’d much rather not delay my travels any longer.” She chastised.

Bran remained unfazed by Arya’s words. He still held his demeanor and spoke with ease. “You will come across a set of choices, sister. I hope you choose wisely.”

Arya raised her brows in confusion, “What choices?”

“You will come to find out. Be safe on your travels and she will be a beautiful babe.” Bran gave one of his rare smiles and gestured for Lord Tyrion to fetch him.

Arya’s face had drained of all color. She knew her brother could see things beyond what normal people could see, but she hadn’t expected him to know of her situation. She silently cursed his all-seeing eyes and rose to stand before him.

He gave a slight nod and Lord Tyrion and her brother began to descend the dock, making their way back to the keep.

Arya sighed and gave one last glance and the keep before her. Drogon’s fire had destroyed most of what was there, but the builders had worked diligently within the last moon to make it suitable for the new king. Aside from the council room, most of the bed chambers had been untouched and livable. And although she would have been fine at some inn in town, she was grateful that she was able to spend her last days in Westeros with her family. The keep had also been filled with horrible memories from her past, memories that she wished to forget.

She hadn’t said goodbye to him. She couldn’t. But she did check on him before he left to ride to Storm’s End. He was in the forge, just hours before he was supposed to ride. Arya had hidden in the shadows, not wanting to be seen. He was banging a hot piece of steel; bending it to his will. He was angry, she could tell. Whenever he was angry, his brows would furrow and his concentration unwavering. A wight could’ve have walked in and he would not have moved an inch. She wanted to study his features; to sear them into her memory. She never wanted to forget what he looked like. His eyes, especially.

She stood there for nearly two hours studying him, until he was summoned by Ser Davos to prepare for their journey. She had looked on in sadness as she saw his figure retreat from the forge.

Now the keep was nothing more than a speck of dust off in the horizon. She could hardly see the castle on the hill and as they got further away, she couldn’t help but feel that maybe she made the wrong choice.

She turned from the stern and walked over to her co-captain. He was no more than twenty and eight, and had years of sailing experience under his worn leather belt. He had been from Bravos and looked every bit of it. His skin was tan from years under the sun and his hair was a light shade of brown.

Arya had met the man soon after the sack of King’s Landing. He had been sailing around Westeros and had docked into the grand city for restock of his ship. He hadn’t meant to stay longer than a day, but his crew had grew restless and wanted to indulge in the local whorehouses. Three days later, his ship was burnt to a crisp and his crew all dead and gone. He had managed to escape the burning by jumping into the sea before the harbor had been destroyed.

When Arya had been recruiting men and women for her journey at a local ale house, he had stumbled in, making aware of his skills at sea. She had immediately hired the man and the rest was history.

“The winds seem good, Aries.” She said to him.

He turned from the wheel and smiled. “Aye, let us hope that they continue this way, Wolfie.”

Arya smiled at the nickname he had given her. It was no surprise that he knew of her and her family. Once she had killed the Night King, word traveled fast and even sailors on the high seas were no strangers to talk.

“Has your…acquaintance made himself comfortable?” She asked.

Aries blushed. He had been discreet with his relationship, but even Arya Stark new that the man had smuggled a lover on board.

“Nothing gets by you, does it?” He gave a weary smile. “But yes, he has made himself quite comfortable in my chambers. I hope you do not mind.”

She placed a soft hand on his arm, “If he makes you happy on this voyage, then no, I do not mind. But, if he does anything stupid, I cannot say that I won’t throw him overboard.”

This made Aries laugh. Although they had only known each other for a short time, he couldn’t help but love the feisty girl he called friend. She was one of the few people who knew about his relations with other men and she had accepted him whole heartedly.

He turned and gave a tight hug. He had owed everything to her, and he couldn’t find any other way to show his gratitude. Arya was taken by surprise by the hug, but returned it swiftly. Aries had become a true friend to her. Ever since his first drunken appearance in the ale house, Arya knew that he would be one to keep in her life.

Aries had noticed the slight bump rising from Arya’s stomach. He pulled back in surprise and his eyes quickly darted to her abdomen. His gaze flickered to hers and she gave a small nod, confirming what he was already suspecting.

He knew better than to ask questions when it came to Arya Stark. But his ever curios mind had got the better of him.

“Did you know, before we embarked on our journey?”

Arya sighed and gave a curt nod.

Aries eyes widen in shock. “You do understand the dangers of,” He lowered his voice so only she could hear, “giving birth on a boat?”

“Yes, I am aware. I have a maester and two chambermaids to help me when the time comes.” She said swiftly.

“And what of the babe, then? What will you do with it?” He questioned.

Arya groaned in frustration, “I haven’t thought that far ahead. I am hoping by time the babe is born, we will reach some foreign land and I can hand it off to a woman who wants a child.”

Aries shook his head, “And if we don’t?”

“Why must you ask such questions?” Arya tried to avoid answering, but Aries knew her games.

“Because no one else will. They are either too scared of you or too preoccupied to care. Do you remember what I told you when you asked me to be your second in command? I said that I will be the one to question your authority if I felt you were doing something wrong and I would not apologize for it. That is what I am doing now. So answer the question.” His voice was hushed but stern. He needed to know what her plans were and perhaps he could steer her in the right direction.

Arya’s eyes grew dark. Aries had only seen her angry one other time in the nearly two moons that he knew her. The first time had been at a drunken man harassing a bar maid. She asked the man to leave the girl alone, twice, and when he still refused, she had stabbed him in the hand.

He was confident that Arya wouldn’t hurt him, but the storm brewing in her grey eyes made him think otherwise.

“When the time come, Aries, I will know what to do. For now, keep your questions to yourself.” Arya’s voice did not waver. She gave him one last stern look, before she retreated under the ship’s dock.

Bran remained unfazed by Arya’s words. He still held his demeanor and spoke with ease. “You will come across a set of choices, sister. I hope you choose wisely.”

Arya raised her brows in confusion, “What choices?”

“You will come to find out. Be safe on your travels and she will be a beautiful babe.” Bran gave one of his rare smiles and gestured for Lord Tyrion to fetch him.

Arya’s face had drained of all color. She knew her brother could see things beyond what normal people could see, but she hadn’t expected him to know of her situation. She silently cursed his all-seeing eyes and rose to stand before him.

He gave a slight nod and Lord Tyrion and her brother began to descend the dock, making their way back to the keep.

Arya sighed and gave one last glance and the keep before her. Drogon’s fire had destroyed most of what was there, but the builders had worked diligently within the last moon to make it suitable for the new king. Aside from the council room, most of the bed chambers had been untouched and livable. And although she would have been fine at some inn in town, she was grateful that she was able to spend her last days in Westeros with her family. The keep had also been filled with horrible memories from her past, memories that she wished to forget.

She hadn’t said goodbye to him. She couldn’t. But she did check on him before he left to ride to Storm’s End. He was in the forge, just hours before he was supposed to ride. Arya had hidden in the shadows, not wanting to be seen. He was banging a hot piece of steel; bending it to his will. He was angry, she could tell. Whenever he was angry, his brows would furrow and his concentration unwavering. A wight could’ve have walked in and he would not have moved an inch. She wanted to study his features; to sear them into her memory. She never wanted to forget what he looked like. His eyes, especially.

She stood there for nearly two hours studying him, until he was summoned by Ser Davos to prepare for their journey. She had looked on in sadness as she saw his figure retreat from the forge.

Now the keep was nothing more than a speck of dust off in the horizon. She could hardly see the castle on the hill and as they got further away, she couldn’t help but feel that maybe she made the wrong choice.

She turned from the stern and walked over to her co-captain. He was no more than twenty and eight, and had years of sailing experience under his worn leather belt. He had been from Bravos and looked every bit of it. His skin was tan from years under the sun and his hair was a light shade of brown.

Arya had met the man soon after the sack of King’s Landing. He had been sailing around Westeros and had docked into the grand city for restock of his ship. He hadn’t meant to stay longer than a day, but his crew had grew restless and wanted to indulge in the local whorehouses. Three days later, his ship was burnt to a crisp and his crew all dead and gone. He had managed to escape the burning by jumping into the sea before the harbor had been destroyed.

When Arya had been recruiting men and women for her journey at a local ale house, he had stumbled in, making aware of his skills at sea. She had immediately hired the man and the rest was history.

“The winds seem good, Aries.” She said to him.

He turned from the wheel and smiled. “Aye, let us hope that they continue this way, Wolfie.”

Arya smiled at the nickname he had given her. It was no surprise that he knew of her and her family. Once she had killed the Night King, word traveled fast and even sailors on the high seas were no strangers to talk.

“Has your…acquaintance made himself comfortable?” She asked.

Aries blushed. He had been discreet with his relationship, but even Arya Stark new that the man had smuggled a lover on board.

“Nothing gets by you, does it?” He gave a weary smile. “But yes, he has made himself quite comfortable in my chambers. I hope you do not mind.”

She placed a soft hand on his arm, “If he makes you happy on this voyage, then no, I do not mind. But, if he does anything stupid, I cannot say that I won’t throw him overboard.”

This made Aries laugh. Although they had only known each other for a short time, he couldn’t help but love the feisty girl he called friend. She was one of the few people who knew about his relations with other men and she had accepted him whole heartedly.

He turned and gave a tight hug. He had owed everything to her, and he couldn’t find any other way to show his gratitude. Arya was taken by surprise by the hug, but returned it swiftly. Aries had become a true friend to her. Ever since his first drunken appearance in the ale house, Arya knew that he would be one to keep in her life.

Aries had noticed the slight bump rising from Arya’s stomach. He pulled back in surprise and his eyes quickly darted to her abdomen. His gaze flickered to hers and she gave a small nod, confirming what he was already suspecting.

He knew better than to ask questions when it came to Arya Stark. But his ever curios mind had got the better of him.

“Did you know, before we embarked on our journey?”

Arya sighed and gave a curt nod.

Aries eyes widen in shock. “You do understand the dangers of,” He lowered his voice so only she could hear, “giving birth on a boat?”

“Yes, I am aware. I have a maester and two chambermaids to help me when the time comes.” She said swiftly.

“And what of the babe, then? What will you do with it?” He questioned.

Arya groaned in frustration, “I haven’t thought that far ahead. I am hoping by time the babe is born, we will reach some foreign land and I can hand it off to a woman who wants a child.”

Aries shook his head, “And if we don’t?”

“Why must you ask such questions?” Arya tried to avoid answering, but Aries knew her games.

“Because no one else will. They are either too scared of you or too preoccupied to care. Do you remember what I told you when you asked me to be your second in command? I said that I will be the one to question your authority if I felt you were doing something wrong and I would not apologize for it. That is what I am doing now. So answer the question.” His voice was hushed but stern. He needed to know what her plans were and perhaps he could steer her in the right direction.

Arya’s eyes grew dark. Aries had only seen her angry one other time in the nearly two moons that he knew her. The first time had been at a drunken man harassing a bar maid. She asked the man to leave the girl alone, twice, and when he still refused, she had stabbed him in the hand.

He was confident that Arya wouldn’t hurt him, but the storm brewing in her grey eyes made him think otherwise.

“When the time come, Aries, I will know what to do. For now, keep your questions to yourself.” Arya’s voice did not waver. She gave him one last stern look, before she retreated under the ship’s dock.

question: Thoughts on Jaqen x Arya?
answer:
I’m generally fine with it, so long as Arya is aged up.

I actually find it to be a realistic romantic pairing for her, seeing as she’s alone in Braavos and he’s one of the only “friends” she has there.

Even their dialogue is filled with heavy innuendos (wtf grrm).

I don’t ship it as an endgame pairing for Arya though, since I ultimately see her in Westeros.

blog.title: Ignorance is for other people

tags: the prince or princess that was promised
body:
Why was Jon’s resurrection necessary?

It could be said that a lot of people tend to dislike last season of Game of thrones. It would be an understatement to say that it is understandable. The main idea of Game of Thrones was lost and the thing they were supposed to replase it with turned out to be not quite as epic as it was supposed to be or as it could have been.

This show had an impact upon society for a long period of time. Naturally, the authors should have felt the pressure. It seems they did not. However, i can’t agree with the opinion that nothing made sense. The finale was a long awaited child of George Martin. It should make perfect sense. And, in a way, it does.

Pawns

So, let’s start with the things we do know. Red priests can’t just ressurect anyone. The lord of light must think that the dead person should have played a key role in his master plans. For example, Beric Dondarrion was returned to the living to protect the Princess that was promised. It appears that The Lord of Light does care about his followers’ survival. This is a thing that makes Jon’s resurrection so important. He is one of Key Five, one of the three dragon heads and a lot of people claimed that he is a Prince that was promised. He was not. He barely did anything during the battle of Winterfell. But, nonetheless, he was a key player.

United we stand, divided we fall

I believe there are several factors there. The Great War plot line shows characters uniting against the Great evil. Despite their many differences and even hatred towards each other, they stood together when it was needed. And it was all thanks to Jon Snow.

Main ingredients. ‘You were exactly where you needed to be’

In order to win humanity had to have their key players right there they needed to be. So Bran, Arya and the Night King could ultimately face each other. This meeting would be hard to organise. But Winterfell, that is home to House Stark, stands between the Night king and the rest of the realm. The Night King is bound to walk past Winterfell and remaining Starkling would always go to Winterfell if it was safe to them. And Winterfell is safe thanks to Jon and Sansa.

Jon had Wildling’s loyalty. He had Stark looks and he has already been a battle comander and, even though it didn’t matter much in the actual battle, it was known. I believe this helped him to win loyalty of northern lords even putting aside the fact that his masculinity was a big plus in the eyes of a patriarchal world of Game of thrones compared to Sansa’s femininity. So, even though Knight of the Vale, Littlefinger and Sansa ultimately won the battle of the bastards, Jon Snow played a huge part in securing Winterfell.

And next season Arya after hearing the news heads to Winterfell. And so does Bran.

'The dead are coming’

But that is not all. Jon spread awareness. Jaime, Hound, Beric Dondarrion and Daenerys all came because he told them about the dead. They believed him. Sansa and Arya who had no idea about that were preparing because of him. (Food and weapons).

Arya needed to live long enough to face the Night King and it would be almost impossible if it wasn’t for one thing. Daenerys. Jon was the one who convinced Dany took her dragons and and her armies and her dragonglass north. Winterfell would not be able to stand so long against the dead without the means to fight them. (At least i suppose that was the point.)

In conclusion, Jon Snow secured the place of battle, found allies, weapons and spread awareness. He was the one who held them all together and that was the reason why he was resurrected.

In order to win humanity had to have their key players right there they needed to be. So Bran, Arya and the Night King could ultimately face each other. This meeting would be hard to organise. But Winterfell, that is home to House Stark, stands between the Night king and the rest of the realm. The Night King is bound to walk past Winterfell and remaining Starkling would always go to Winterfell if it was safe to them. And Winterfell is safe thanks to Jon and Sansa.

Jon had Wildling’s loyalty. He had Stark looks and he has already been a battle comander and, even though it didn’t matter much in the actual battle, it was known. I believe this helped him to win loyalty of northern lords even putting aside the fact that his masculinity was a big plus in the eyes of a patriarchal world of Game of thrones compared to Sansa’s femininity. So, even though Knight of the Vale, Littlefinger and Sansa ultimately won the battle of the bastards, Jon Snow played a huge part in securing Winterfell.

And next season Arya after hearing the news heads to Winterfell. And so does Bran.

'The dead are coming’

But that is not all. Jon spread awareness. Jaime, Hound, Beric Dondarrion and Daenerys all came because he told them about the dead. They believed him. Sansa and Arya who had no idea about that were preparing because of him. (Food and weapons).

Arya needed to live long enough to face the Night King and it would be almost impossible if it wasn’t for one thing. Daenerys. Jon was the one who convinced Dany took her dragons and and her armies and her dragonglass north. Winterfell would not be able to stand so long against the dead without the means to fight them. (At least i suppose that was the point.)

In conclusion, Jon Snow secured the place of battle, found allies, weapons and spread awareness. He was the one who held them all together and that was the reason why he was resurrected.

tags: adventures of ser mom and ser dad and their dumbass northern kids
summary:
Jaime: It's not that bad right? 
Arya: It's really bad, my dude. 
Pod: So bad. 
Sansa: You do realize all the lords of the...
body:
Jaime: It’s not that bad right?

Arya: It’s really bad, my dude.

Pod: So bad.

Sansa: You do realize all the lords of the Stormlands will be here today, don’t you?

Jaime: I’m well aware of that, captain obvious. Why the hell do you think I’m freaking out?!

Arya: Hey! Don’t be rude to her just because you’re a dumbass.

Jaime: Ok, look! Brienne can’t be mad at me for this. Right? It was clearly an accident.

Gendry: It would be an accident if this was the first time, but this has happened the last three times.

(Brienne walks into the room)

Brienne: Jaime, I-

Brienne: Ahh seven hells, Lannister.

Jaime: Don’t be mad! Joanna wanted to play dress up and you know I can never tell her no! And I thought she was just using makeup but it was permanent markers and I can’t get the blue off my eyelids or the pink off my cheeks and I’m soooo sorry!

Brienne: I told you to hide those markers after the last three times this happened.

Jaime:…I forgot.

Brienne: Alright, well nothing we can do about it now.

(later that day in the great hall)

Brienne: Good evening, my lords, and welcome to our home. I’m Ser Brienne of Tarth.

Brienne, pointing to Jaime: And this is my husband, Princess Cupcake of Sparkle Mountain.

Jaime, holding Joanna on his lap: *both beaming*

I want Arya to have relationships with people who arent just Jon and Sansa
summary: College Gendrya AU where Arya and Lyanna Mormont share a dorm room with Shireen Baratheon. Shireen grew up isolated from others...
body:
College Gendrya AU where Arya and Lyanna Mormont share a dorm room with Shireen Baratheon. Shireen grew up isolated from others because of her greyscale and Arya and Lyanna are the first people she makes friends with who aren’t related to her or serve her family. Arya finds herself trying to juggle her dorm family commitments, her coursework, her new friendship with Shireen’s stubborn cousin Gendry and Ned Dayne’s crush on her.

Extra stuff:

  • Shireen and Gendry being supportive cousins who both felt on the outside growing up and stuck together
  • Arya making strong friendships with others girls and still carves out her special friendship with Gendry
  • Lyanna smashing all the frat boys at beer pong
  • Misunderstandings because Gendry thinks Arya is angry about him being jealous over Ned’s crush on Arya when she’s actually annoyed that Ned won’t take a hint and that the female bartender from The Inn won’t stop eyeing Gendry.
  • Arya and Lyanna drag Shireen to a boxing class run by The Hound.
  • Gendry is the only one with a car and ends up going along on far too many late night big box shopping trips that the girls swear are absolutely necessary.
  • Lyanna gets bored and spends her time trolling awful guys on Tinder and putting them in their place.
  • Shireen goes on a date.
  • Arya almost burns down their dorm room trying to make mug brownies in their smuggled in microwave.
  • Arya and Gendry spend a whole lot of time arguing and being jealous when they’ve actually being dating for months without knowing it.

Someone feel absolutely free to write this or something inspired by this. If you do drop me a message when you publish it!
